attributes.action: Reverse £1bn of Cuts to Met Police Damaging its Ability to Respond to Terrorism
attributes.additional_details:
More information regarding Met police cuts: http://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2015/oct/14/met-police-chief-cuts-safety-public

The current UK threat level for international terrorism is SEVERE.
This means that a terrorist attack is highly likely.
Source: https://www.mi5.gov.uk/home/about-us/faqs-about-mi5/what-is-the-current-national-threat-level.html
attributes.background:
Sir Bernard Hogan-Howe, commissioner of the Metropolitan police, believes Met would lose £1bn by 2020 and shrink to levels last seen in the 1970s and that we can expect to lose 5,000 - 8,000 police officers, damaging Met's ability to respond to a terrorist attack.

We demand adequate protection.
